{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3536739,"name":"","username":"atharv-team1403","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f1d935/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T22:28:13.442Z","cooked":"

The radio powers on and shows a 1hz sys light, solid pwr light and 1 hz rio light, but neither the 6G or 2.4G bands are active on the radio, and the network does does not show up on our computers. We also did not configure it as an access point, and we updated the firmware to version 1.3.0.

On the back of the radio there are three switches. They are underneath a caution sticker. Flip the one numbered 3. This turns on the 2.4 broadcasting.

17402634208847206309282961727761920×2550 228 KB

Note:

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/practicing-at-home

There are a number of different methods to connect to the robot radio and the 2.4GHz radio although works - has been known to cause robot disconnects when the radio is on for more than a few min. and heats up if not properly heatsinked - or if your wireless environment has stronger and more numerous radios.

6GHz connections are the recommended connection LINK and for teams that have gotten them working few if any complaints exist to my knowledge (outside of firmware memory corruption that could happen regardless of which band radio is used)

Did you reconfigure the radio after updating the firmware? Updating it clears the configuration.
